text: While generating the access token , Automatically its click on the tick mark on the consent page and generating the access token .Can anyone please help
it seems like the app is already installed in the portal, goto settings > integration > connected apps and uninstall your app, if you want to test the complete flow again <@U02UP0J65L4>
Sure, thank you so much for the response. let me try and will inform you

<@UCH1L597V>, I understood that the below screen is not taking the users' response(approve or cancel) when the app is already installed. But it pretends to be an issue for users, even if they click on cancel it's sending a successful response. There is no use in getting that consent screen when the app is already installed during authorization and it is bringing more confusion to users.
Agree, but the proper way to re-install the app is first uninstall it and then install.
This is because the app is already installed
<@UCH1L597V> Exactly, <@U02UP0J65L4> we just talked about this in the api channel a couple of days ago. <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C2YHAHB6K/p1668146548803849>
```Hello, I want to create several multilanguage pages. Do you know if HubSpot offers any tool for automatic translation?```

Hello everyone.
Can anyone help to make a HubSpot API contacts list with a filter by owner email?
Docs say we have to be a super admin for private apps. Can we state that in the warning message? This message led me to believe I could get access
true, but I think the message is supposed to mean "contact your super admins to get a private app key" or at least that's how I read it
But the phrasing can definitely be misleading
here’s the api key warning/info message for contrast
Hi Team
We are trying migrate the HubSpot API key to private app .But we could not know which scope we need to select.So please assist
Hi team, so we are trying to integrate HubSpot webhooks and we were wondering is there a Webhook for contact opting out of emails pls? This has been a chalenge for days now

Hi <@U04AZ0L47NZ>
You can find the scope required for each endpoint in the HubSpot API documentation > Endpoints tab.
In the requirements section HubSpot listed the scopes required by this endpoint. in the private app, in scopes tab, select the same scope marked in the documentation as a granular scope. (If isn't marked any granular scope, you can use the standard scope instead)

hi team, does anyone have an example of a coded Update Your Preferences template that has the main subscription type (Marketing emails) then tickboxes for interests (ie Cycling / Events / Restaurants)

Hey all,

Can anyone help explain how `builtin_body_classes` generates classes? I am creating a second blog for a client that is basically a clone of the first one. The listing templates and everything are the same but the classes being generated by `builtin_body_classes` are different and it's throwing off the styling.

What is driving this and is it possible to control what classes are being produced?

They don't just multi-language support for pages, I think you're best bet will probably be google translate, use the cloud version if you're running through a lot of pages: <https://cloud.google.com/translate/docs/advanced/batch-translation>

Hey everyone! I'm trying to connect Tray (our iPaaS provider of choice) to HubSpot, but I keep getting the following error:
```Couldn't complete the connection
Insufficient scopes were provided. Please contact the app developer.```
It looks like the permissions are aligned though. I'm requesting:
```crm.objects.companies.read
crm.objects.contacts.read
crm.objects.deals.read
crm.objects.owners.read
crm.objects.contacts.write
crm.objects.companies.write
crm.objects.deals.write
crm.objects.custom.read```
And the app has:
```crm.objects.owners.read
settings.users.teams.read
crm.objects.contacts.write
crm.objects.custom.read
crm.objects.companies.write
crm.objects.companies.read
settings.users.read
crm.objects.deals.read
crm.objects.deals.write
crm.objects.contacts.read
crm.lists.read```

Oh, this sounds super interesting. Could you share the two sets of classes that are being generated?

I can’t say that I have much insight into the particular inner workings of that tag, but I’d still be very interested in seeing what’s going on here.
No one knows this :smiley:

Hello,

We run a text messaging app in HubSpot, what is the best way to update a contact when an icoming SMS is received OR the contact clicks on our tracking short URL?

We are looking for the best way to trigger an event in HubSpot this way a contact is marked as - replied to SMS and/or clicked on the link we sent.

Thanks

Paul
